parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party. It promotes an open training session for a local football team, Gloria Ultra.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide geographical area in Romania (Botoșani County and surrounding areas), aiming to reach a large audience interested in local sports.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a public event, a football team's open training session. There is no discernible intention to influence the outcome of any election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of local news or community announcement, similar to what a local news outlet might publish. It informs the public about a local event.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>457140753719233</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a local sports event, an open training session for the Gloria Ultra football team.  It does not mention any political candidates, parties, or advocate for or against any political position. The targeting is geographically focused, but this is common for local event promotion and does not inherently constitute electoral propaganda. The content is purely informational and lacks any electoral objective.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and is not in violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea - Dorohoi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
